title: BT Sport 'set to win bidding war' to retain rights to broadcast Champions League
text:

BT Sport are expected to win the bidding war to retain the rights to broadcast the Champions League. 
Sky will rival their rivals for the coverage but are having doubts over whether to fork out the £1billion required to reacquire the rights, according to the Daily Mail. 
If BT do retain the rights they will broadcast the competition for a further three seasons from the 2018-19 campaign. 
The tender deadline is on Wednesday and BT's need to keep the rights is understood to be greater than Sky's desire to acquire them. Gary Lineker has fronted BT Sport's Champions League coverage (Photo: C1 Photography 2015) Real Madrid won their 11th title last season (Photo: Reuters) Read More Premier League clubs set to get sponsors on their sleeves from 2017/18 season 
BT's ratings for Europe's flagship competition have been considerably lower than Sky and ITV boasted in the previous cycle. 
But UEFA priorities income rather than ratings and commanded £900million for the three seasons of the current deal. 
The hope for terrestrial television is that BT agree a sub-contract with ITV when they have agreed a package to keep the coverage. poll loading Whose coverage do you prefer? 500+ VOTES SO FAR
